channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: EventNet: Detecting Events in EEG
item.description: We propose an end-to-end event detection approach (EventNet), based on deep learning, that directly works with events as learning targets, stepping away from ad-hoc postprocessing schemes to turn model outputs into events.

item.title: MnTTS: An Open-Source Mongolian Text-to-Speech Synthesis Dataset and Accompanied Baseline
item.description: This paper introduces a high-quality open-source text-to-speech (TTS) synthesis dataset for Mongolian, a low-resource language spoken by over 10 million people worldwide.

item.title: In Differential Privacy, There is Truth: On Vote Leakage in Ensemble Private Learning
item.description: When learning from sensitive data, care must be taken to ensure that training algorithms address privacy concerns.

item.title: Pretraining the Vision Transformer using self-supervised methods for vision based Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The Vision Transformer architecture has shown to be competitive in the computer vision (CV) space where it has dethroned convolution-based networks in several benchmarks.

item.title: CMGAN: Conformer-Based Metric-GAN for Monaural Speech Enhancement
item.description: Convolution-augmented transformers (Conformers) are recently proposed in various speech-domain applications, such as automatic speech recognition (ASR) and speech separation, as they can capture both local and global dependencies.

item.title: Poisson Flow Generative Models
item.description: We interpret the data points as electrical charges on the $z=0$ hyperplane in a space augmented with an additional dimension $z$, generating a high-dimensional electric field (the gradient of the solution to Poisson equation).

item.title: Counterfactual Explanations Using Optimization With Constraint Learning
item.description: Counterfactual explanations embody one of the many interpretability techniques that receive increasing attention from the machine learning community.

item.title: DIG: Draping Implicit Garment over the Human Body
item.description: Existing data-driven methods for draping garments over posed human bodies, despite being effective, cannot handle garments of arbitrary topology and are typically not end-to-end differentiable.

item.title: NamedMask: Distilling Segmenters from Complementary Foundation Models
item.description: Our method, termed NamedMask, begins by using CLIP to construct category-specific archives of images.

item.title: An Information Minimization Based Contrastive Learning Model for Unsupervised Sentence Embeddings Learning
item.description: To address this problem, we present an information minimization based contrastive learning (InforMin-CL) model to retain the useful information and discard the redundant information by maximizing the mutual information and minimizing the information entropy between positive instances meanwhile for unsupervised sentence representation learning.

item.title: DLUNet: Semi-supervised Learning based Dual-Light UNet for Multi-organ Segmentation
item.description: In the training phase, it consists of two light UNets, which make full use of label and unlabeled data simultaneously by using consistent-based learning.

item.title: Identifiability and generalizability from multiple experts in Inverse Reinforcement Learning
item.description: While Reinforcement Learning (RL) aims to train an agent from a reward function in a given environment, Inverse Reinforcement Learning (IRL) seeks to recover the reward function from observing an expert's behavior.

item.title: Identity-Aware Hand Mesh Estimation and Personalization from RGB Images
item.description: In this paper, we propose an identity-aware hand mesh estimation model, which can incorporate the identity information represented by the intrinsic shape parameters of the subject.

item.title: Equivariant Transduction through Invariant Alignment
item.description: The ability to generalize compositionally is key to understanding the potentially infinite number of sentences that can be constructed in a human language from only a finite number of words.

item.title: CAMRI Loss: Improving Recall of a Specific Class without Sacrificing Accuracy
item.description: Therefore, we propose a loss function that can improve the separation of the important class by setting the margin only for the important class, called Class-sensitive Additive Angular Margin Loss (CAMRI Loss).

item.title: Automated head and neck tumor segmentation from 3D PET/CT
item.description: Head and neck tumor segmentation challenge (HECKTOR) 2022 offers a platform for researchers to compare their solutions to segmentation of tumors and lymph nodes from 3D CT and PET images.

item.title: Physical Interaction: Reconstructing Hand-object Interactions with Physics
item.description: Single view-based reconstruction of hand-object interaction is challenging due to the severe observation missing caused by occlusions.

item.title: Dynamic Response Recovery Using Ambient Synchrophasor Data: A Synthetic Texas Interconnection Case Study
item.description: Wide-area dynamic studies are of paramount importance to ensure the stability and reliability of power grids.

item.title: A Closer Look at Learned Optimization: Stability, Robustness, and Inductive Biases
item.description: We apply the resulting learned optimizer to a variety of neural network training tasks, where it outperforms the current state of the art learned optimizer -- at matched optimizer computational overhead -- with regard to optimization performance and meta-training speed, and is capable of generalization to tasks far different from those it was meta-trained on.

item.title: Simulation-based inference of Bayesian hierarchical models while checking for model misspecification
item.description: This paper presents recent methodological advances to perform simulation-based inference (SBI) of a general class of Bayesian hierarchical models (BHMs), while checking for model misspecification.

item.title: A Bibliographic View on Constrained Clustering
item.description: A keyword search on constrained clustering on Web-of-Science returned just under 3, 000 documents.

item.title: Challenges in Visual Anomaly Detection for Mobile Robots
item.description: We consider the task of detecting anomalies for autonomous mobile robots based on vision.

item.title: Concept Activation Regions: A Generalized Framework For Concept-Based Explanations
item.description: We further demonstrate empirically that CARs offer (1) more accurate descriptions of how concepts are scattered in the DNN's latent space; (2) global explanations that are closer to human concept annotations and (3) concept-based feature importance that meaningfully relate concepts with each other.

item.title: Layer Freezing & Data Sieving: Missing Pieces of a Generic Framework for Sparse Training
item.description: Therefore, we analyze the feasibility and potentiality of using the layer freezing technique in sparse training and find it has the potential to save considerable training costs.

item.title: AcroFOD: An Adaptive Method for Cross-domain Few-shot Object Detection
item.description: Under the domain shift, cross-domain few-shot object detection aims to adapt object detectors in the target domain with a few annotated target data.

item.title: Deep Lake: a Lakehouse for Deep Learning
item.description: Traditional data lakes provide critical data infrastructure for analytical workloads by enabling time travel, running SQL queries, ingesting data with ACID transactions, and visualizing petabyte-scale datasets on cloud storage.

item.title: VToonify: Controllable High-Resolution Portrait Video Style Transfer
item.description: Although a series of successful portrait image toonification models built upon the powerful StyleGAN have been proposed, these image-oriented methods have obvious limitations when applied to videos, such as the fixed frame size, the requirement of face alignment, missing non-facial details and temporal inconsistency.

item.title: Entropic Descent Archetypal Analysis for Blind Hyperspectral Unmixing
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a new algorithm based on archetypal analysis for blind hyperspectral unmixing, assuming linear mixing of endmembers.

item.title: MGTR: End-to-End Mutual Gaze Detection with Transformer
item.description: People's looking at each other or mutual gaze is ubiquitous in our daily interactions, and detecting mutual gaze is of great significance for understanding human social scenes.

item.title: MLGWSC-1: The first Machine Learning Gravitational-Wave Search Mock Data Challenge
item.description: The final of the 4 provided datasets contained real noise from the O3a observing run and signals up to a duration of 20 seconds with the inclusion of precession effects and higher order modes.

item.title: Implementing and Experimenting with Diffusion Models for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: In this thesis, we aim to contribute by firstly reviewing the different approaches and techniques used by these models, and then by proposing our own implementation of a text-to-image model.

item.title: Efficient Few-Shot Learning Without Prompts
item.description: This simple framework requires no prompts or verbalizers, and achieves high accuracy with orders of magnitude less parameters than existing techniques.

item.title: Predicting pairwise preferences between TTS audio stimuli using parallel ratings data and anti-symmetric twin neural networks
item.description: While previous work has focused on predicting listeners' ratings (mean opinion scores) of individual stimuli, we focus on the simpler task of predicting subjective preference given two speech stimuli for the same text.

item.title: Homophone Reveals the Truth: A Reality Check for Speech2Vec
item.description: There is no indication that these embeddings are generated by the Speech2Vec model.

item.title: MonoByte: A Pool of Monolingual Byte-level Language Models
item.description: The zero-shot cross-lingual ability of models pretrained on multilingual and even monolingual corpora has spurred many hypotheses to explain this intriguing empirical result.

item.title: Semantically Consistent Data Augmentation for Neural Machine Translation via Conditional Masked Language Model
item.description: In addition, to enhance diversity, we incorporate the idea of soft word substitution for data augmentation which replaces a word with a probabilistic distribution over the vocabulary.

item.title: Proximal Point Imitation Learning
item.description: Thanks to PPM, we avoid nested policy evaluation and cost updates for online IL appearing in the prior literature.

item.title: How Good Is Neural Combinatorial Optimization?
item.description: Traditional solvers for tackling combinatorial optimization (CO) problems are usually designed by human experts.

item.title: SCALES: From Fairness Principles to Constrained Decision-Making
item.description: This paper proposes SCALES, a general framework that translates well-established fairness principles into a common representation based on the Constraint Markov Decision Process (CMDP).

item.title: Adaptation of domain-specific transformer models with text oversampling for sentiment analysis of social media posts on Covid-19 vaccines
item.description: Covid-19 has spread across the world and several vaccines have been developed to counter its surge.

item.title: Neural Generalized Ordinary Differential Equations with Layer-varying Parameters
item.description: Deep residual networks (ResNets) have shown state-of-the-art performance in various real-world applications.

item.title: DeepVARwT: Deep Learning for a VAR Model with Trend
item.description: This is a model for stationary time series which can be extended to allow the presence of a deterministic trend in each series.

item.title: Periodic Extrapolative Generalisation in Neural Networks
item.description: The learning of the simplest possible computational pattern -- periodicity -- is an open problem in the research of strong generalisation in neural networks.

item.title: HiFuse: Hierarchical Multi-Scale Feature Fusion Network for Medical Image Classification
item.description: A parallel hierarchy of local and global feature blocks is designed to efficiently extract local features and global representations at various semantic scales, with the flexibility to model at different scales and linear computational complexity relevant to image size.

item.title: Rethinking the compositionality of point clouds through regularization in the hyperbolic space
item.description: In this paper, we propose to embed the features of a point cloud classifier into the hyperbolic space and explicitly regularize the space to account for the part-whole hierarchy.

item.title: Uncertainty-aware Label Distribution Learning for Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new uncertainty-aware label distribution learning method to improve the robustness of deep models against uncertainty and ambiguity.

item.title: Estimation of circular statistics in the presence of measurement bias
item.description: The objective of this paper is to present a method to estimate circular statistics and their statistical significance even in this circumstance.

item.title: SoLar: Sinkhorn Label Refinery for Imbalanced Partial-Label Learning
item.description: Partial-label learning (PLL) is a peculiar weakly-supervised learning task where the training samples are generally associated with a set of candidate labels instead of single ground truth.

item.title: Revisiting Discrete Soft Actor-Critic
item.description: We study the adaption of soft actor-critic (SAC) from continuous action space to discrete action space.

item.title: Benchmarking and Analyzing 3D Human Pose and Shape Estimation Beyond Algorithms
item.description: Experiments with 10 backbones, ranging from CNNs to transformers, show the knowledge learnt from a proximity task is readily transferable to human mesh recovery.
